required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 3 Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Ivacaftor and VX-661 in Combination With Ivacaftor in Subjects Aged 12 Years and Older With Cystic Fibrosis, Heterozygous for the F508del-cystic Fibrosis Transmembrane Conductance Regulator (CFTR) Mutation
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Crossover Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Ivacaftor and VX-661 in Combination With Ivacaftor in Subjects Aged 12 Years and Older With Cystic Fibrosis, Heterozygous for the F508del-CFTR Mutation, and a Second Allele With a CFTR Mutation Predicted to Have Residual Function

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of VX-661 in combination with ivacaftor (IVA, VX-770) and IVA monotherapy in participants with Cystic Fibrosis (CF) who are heterozygous for F508del-CFTR allele and a second allele with a CFTR mutation predicted to have residual function.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Study Baseline in Percent Predicted Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (ppFEV1) at Average of Week 4 and Week 8
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4 and Week 8 of each treatment period
primary_outcome.description: FEV1 is the volume of air that can forcibly be blown out in one second, after full inspiration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Study Baseline in Cystic Fibrosis Questionnaire-Revised (CFQ-R) Respiratory Domain Score at Average of Week 4 and Week 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4 and Week 8 of each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: The CFQ-R assessed respiratory symptoms on a scale with scores ranging from 0 to 100; where higher scores indicated fewer symptoms and better health-related quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
Relative Change From Study Baseline in ppFEV1 at Average of Week 4 and Week 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4 and Week 8 of each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 is the volume of air that can forcibly be blown out in one second, after full inspiration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Study Baseline in Sweat Chloride at Average of Week 4 and Week 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4 and Week 8 of each treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough Plasma Concentrations (Ctrough) of VX-661, VX-661 Metabolites (M1 VX-661), IVA and IVA Metabolite (M1 IVA) After Administration of VX-661/IVA Combination Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-morning dose on Week 8 of each treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Ctrough of IVA and IVA Metabolite (M1 IVA) After Administration of IVA Monotherapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-morning dose on Week 8 of each treatment period

intervention.description: Fixed dose combination tablet, oral use
Fixed dose combination tablet, oral use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Heterozygous for F508del-CFTR and a second allele with a CFTR mutation predicted to have residual function
- Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) greater than or equal to (≥) 40 percent (%) and less than or equal to (≤) 90% of predicted normal for age, sex, and height during screening
- Sweat chloride value ≥60 millimole per liter (mmol/L) during screening OR as documented in the participant's medical record
- Stable CF disease as judged by the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of any comorbidity that, in the opinion of the investigator, might confound the results of the study or pose an additional risk in administering study drug to the participant
- An acute upper or lower respiratory infection, pulmonary exacerbation
- History of solid organ or hematological transplantation
- Ongoing or prior participation in an investigational drug study (including studies investigating VX-661, lumacaftor [VX-809], and/or ivacaftor) within 30 days of screening
- Pregnant and nursing females
- Sexually active participants of reproductive potential who are not willing to follow the contraception requirements

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 248 participants were enrolled. Out of which, 246 received at least 1 dose of study drug were included in safety set and 244 participants who carried intended cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) mutations were included in Full analysis set.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were randomized to 1 of 6 treatment sequences, each of which included 2 treatment periods and 2 of 3 potential treatments (placebo, VX-661/ivacaftor [IVA], IVA). Treatment periods were separated by an 8 week wash-out period.

group.title: First VX-661/IVA, Then IVA
group.description: VX-661 100 milligram (mg) plus IVA 150 mg fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet and placebo matched to IVA in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by IVA 150 mg tablet and placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

group.title: First VX-661/IVA, Then Placebo
group.description: VX-661 100 mg plus IVA 150 mg FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, placebo matched to IVA tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

group.title: First IVA, Then Placebo
group.description: IVA 150 mg tablet and placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, placebo matched to IVA tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

group.title: First IVA, Then VX- 661/IVA
group.description: IVA 150 mg tablet and placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by VX-661 100 mg plus IVA 150 mg FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

group.title: First Placebo, Then VX- 661/IVA
group.description: Placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, placebo matched to IVA tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by VX-661 100 mg plus IVA 150 mg FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

group.title: First Placebo, Then IVA
group.description: Placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, placebo matched to IVA tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by IVA 150 mg tablet and placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

baseline.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) was defined as all randomized subjects who carry the intended cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) mutations and had received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: First VX- 661/IVA, Then IVA
group.description: VX-661 100 mg plus IVA 150 mg FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by IVA 150 mg tablet and placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

group.title: First VX-661/IVA, Then Placebo
group.description: VX-661 100 mg plus IVA 150 mg FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, placebo matched to IVA tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

group.title: First IVA, Then Placebo
group.description: IVA 150 mg tablet and placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, placebo matched to IVA tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

group.title: First IVA, Then VX- 661/IVA
group.description: IVA 150 mg tablet and placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by VX-661 100 mg plus IVA 150 mg FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

group.title: First Placebo, Then VX- 661/IVA
group.description: Placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, placebo matched to IVA tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by VX-661 100 mg plus IVA 150 mg FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

group.title: First Placebo, Then IVA
group.description: Placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, placebo matched to IVA tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 followed by IVA 150 mg tablet and placebo matched to VX-661 plus IVA FDC tablet in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 2. Each treatment period was separated by a minimum 8 weeks of washout period.

outcome.title: Absolute Change From Study Baseline in Percent Predicted Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (ppFEV1) at Average of Week 4 and Week 8
outcome.description: FEV1 is the volume of air that can forcibly be blown out in one second, after full inspiration.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4 and Week 8 of each treatment period
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all randomized participants who carry the protocol specified cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator gene (CFTR) mutations and had received at least 1 dose of study drug. Here ‘Overall Number of participants analyzed’ signifies those participants who had evaluable data for this outcome measure.

group.description: Placebo matched to VX-661/Ivacaftor (IVA) fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet and placebo matched to IVA tablet in the morning, placebo matched to IVA tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 and 2.

group.description: VX-661 100 mg/IVA 150 mg FDC tablet and placebo matched to IVA in the morning, IVA 150 mg tablet in the evening for 8 weeks in treatment period 1 and 2.

event.sub_title: Infective pulmonary exacerbation of cystic fibrosis
Infective pulmonary exacerbation of cystic fibrosis

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: PI is free to publish results of the study after (1) the first multi-center publication, (2) if the sponsor elects not to publish the results, or (3) 18 months after close of the study, whichever occurs first. Proposed publications are to be submitted to the sponsor for review and comment for a period of at least 45 days (which may be extended under certain circumstances related to protection of intellectual property); the sponsor cannot require changes to the proposed publications.
